knowledge.question: The Logical Link Control (LLC) layer is a sub-layer to which Open System Interconnection (OSI) layer?
explanation: Data Link has two sublayers: a Media Access Control (MAC) layer that directly interfaces with the network medium and a LLC Layer that controls frame synchronization, flow control and error checking.
Network provides switching and routing technologies, creating logical paths; it doesn't have a LLC layer.
Session establishes, manages and terminates connections between applications; it doesn't have a LLC layer.
Physical conveys the bit stream - electrical impulse, light or radio signal through the network at the electrical and mechanical level; it doesn't have a LLC layer.
